Posts.Title: HOSPICE

Posts.Content:
For the first time ever, my mother did not feel up to hosting Christmas this year, so I am...yikes!! Thirteen people, when I have china place settings for 12!! But it should be fun. My brother and his wife are in from California, my (pregnant !!!) niece from Boston, and my nephew from Cincinnati. Both of my kids will be here, too. Brother and sister-in-law will be staying here for a few nights, so it will be a noisy and tiring (but fun) holiday.
Merry Christmas, Happy Hanukkah, etc etc etc! 
Peg V
Posts.Title: What are all the breast friends doing for Christmas this year?

Posts.Content:
I got it too, and found it very unsettling. There were several addressees who are no longer with us, so someone is messing with our old address information...might be worth pointing out to someone in a technical position on this board.
Stay warm, from snowy Ohio (the weather folks are discussing whether what we are now experiencing qualifies as a blizzard...)
Peg V
Posts.Title: A HEART SKIPPING E-MAIL

Posts.Content:
It's been a long time, folks. Sorry to have been AWOL so long. I've been busy working (planning to retire soon though). Actually I'm supposed to be working from home today (taking a break right now, LOL), because the weather turned crappy and I didn't feel like fighting it today. My work laptop is just to my left, frowning at me because I'm not tapping away on its keys, he he he. But since I forgot to bring home my power cord, the battery will die soon, and I'll just have to wing it from my home computer (no email from work, what a shame)!
Every once in a while I jump on HealingWell to see how everybody's doing, and was sad to see you're having more treatments, Cathi. Hope it goes well, and does some good for you.
I was also sad to see that you're having problems, MK. Hope they get resolved, or at least you find something that helps you get around easier.
And Lori, I'd love to come to the gathering to catch up with everybody, but I can't that weekend. I've kind of got all my travel budget spent anyway (going to Santa Fe/Albuquerque in April, Boston in May, and on an Alaska cruise in August -- then I have to stay home and work to pay for it all). 
I have three pictures of my Breast Friends as part of my screen saver -- one from Las Vegas, one from Susan's funeral (me, Peggy, and Luci), and one of Susan, and MK that I think was taken at our second Myrtle Beach gathering. Keeps you all in my thoughts and my heart. 
So, everybody, be well !!!
Love, Peg V
Posts.Title: Cathi sends love..

Posts.Content:
I'm doing just peachy. This summer will be my NINE-year mark, so I'm happy about
 that. I ran into a woman on the elevator today at work who knew who I was and knew I'm a survivor, although I didn't remember ever meeting her. She's just one year out, but looked great.
I left work early today because of the weather (the company sent a blanket email giving us permission to go home at 2:00). I left at 2:30, and it took me an hour and a half to get home, a trip that I can make in 25 minutes in good weather. Didn't get over 25 miles an hour the whole way home. Now the weather folks are debating whether what's expected for tomorrow qualifies as a blizzard. I'm ready for spring, big time.
My kids are doing as well as can be expected for college students (stressed out). My DD just broke up with her boyfriend of over a year, and is living alone, so is lonely. But she'll have to learn to deal with that (tough love stuff here--and she's three hours away, so we don't see her as often as WE would like). My DS is heading into finals week next week, so I don't want to even call him! My DH retired last October, and I'm SO jealous, especially on days like today, when he never left the house. I'm thinking that 2010 sounds like a good year for me to retire.
We have an aging dog, a mutt named Wilson, who is starting to do weird things, like following me around, even into the bathroom and the laundry room. He hates it when my DH goes down to the basement and starts making scary noises (sawing wood, etc). He tries to find a place to hide as far away from the basement as he can, which is usually under the desk this computer sits on. He doesn't make a very good footstool. I think his health is failing, and the vet wants us to bring him in to have his teeth cleaned, but I'm afraid he wouldn't survive the anesthesia. So we live with his breath, which is like something crawled into his mouth and died.
I'm trying to log on more often because I miss you guys....maybe I'll make it to a gathering someday.
Love you all, Peg V

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> I left at 2 30  and it took me an

Posts.Title: What's new everyone?? Updates wanted...

Posts.Content:
MK, I have one daughter, and that sounds exactly like how she would act. Very independent. Very frustrating for parents! So, my heartiest sympathies!!!!
You're in my thoughts!! Stay warm, and stay positive! Sounds like the docs have a handle on the situation.
Love, Peg
Posts.Title: Here's the course of action for the next month at least.

Posts.Content:
Hi, folks, long time no post! (Sorry -- I'm still working full time, that's my excuse and I'm sticking to it)
Anyhow, I'm walking the 5k in this Saturday's Race for the Cure, with my DH, DD, and two of her friends. I'll be thinking of you all !!!!
Whatever happened to our proposed get-together in May? 
Love and kisses, Peg
Posts.Title: Race for the Cure in Columbus

Posts.Content:
Sounds so wonderful...the last concert I went to was Elton John, and it was FABULOUS. I bought foam ear plugs, and didn't use them, but the sound was the best I think I've ever experience for a large venue. But of course, the ears still were ringing for a while.
Thanks for the list of all of those songs, I've got to go to iTunes and grab a few!
love, Peg
Posts.Title: Later in the evening, as you lie awake in bed, with the echoes.....

Posts.Content:
Well, it's still snowing here. They were saying we're having the coldest February on record. 
about
 the robins...on the news yesterday they said that the robins that stick around in central Ohio all winter are usually a hardy lot, but they're dying now because all of their food supply is frozen. They don't eat birdseed (so the normal bird feeder won't help), but they do eat suet. Their normal diet is insects (hah! they're long gone or buried) and berries, which are frozen. Poor things!
I worked from home two days last week when Delaware county was at level 2 and then 3...I would have gotten a lot more done if my DH weren't also home, and interrupting me all the time!! He works for Dublin schools (two suburbs to the west of us), so he was home when they closed. Some of the school districts have used more than their planned five "calamity days." Westerville schools will have to forgo a day off on Memorial Day to make up the sixth day they used last week. I'm glad my kids are in college, and I don't have to mess with babysitters and fouled-up Memorial Day plans.
I'm getting cabin fever, though, so my sister and I are going to venture out today to explore a knitting store in Columbus I heard about
. The roads have been cleared for the most part, so I don't expect any problems....
Stay warm, everybody!!!
Love, Peg
Posts.Title: Baby it's cold outside!!!!

Posts.Content:
My favorite is a quilted "sweatshirt jacket" made by my talented sister (also a two-time BC survivor). She takes a sweatshirt, disassembles it, makes a pieced jacket, and uses the sweatshirt as backing. She sews the sweatshirt cuffs and collar back on. Like I said, she's talented!
Peg
Posts.Title: What was your favorite Holiday Gift this year?

Posts.Content:
I hate that word, "abnormal." My thoughts are with you, Debbie! I hope it's a simple fix. I had an "abnormal" Pap smear last year, and they just told me to come back in three months for a second one, and the second one was normal. Wishing that good luck for you as well....
Love, Peg
Posts.Title: OK, I am trying not to freak out here..........

Posts.Content:
I would love to come. May would be better for me because I'm spending a week in March at my sister's in Arizona, so I would prefer a month in between so I'm not off work so much close together (did that sentence even remotely make sense?????)
Let me know if you need any help in the planning (anything that can be done at a distance).
Peg
Posts.Title: A 2007 gathering?

Posts.Content:
Hi, Cathi...sorry to be awol so long. I do check in occasionally, but seeing this post, I just HAD to respond.
I'm so sorry you have to go through this. At least they were watching you closely for a reaction (and boy, sounds like you gave them a doozy). I hope they can find something in the growing list of chemo drugs that will do you some good and let you breathe at the same time.
I think of you often. Take care.
Love you lots. Peg
Posts.Title: Cathi...how was chemo?

Posts.Content:
2006 was my 7-year mark, and my hair is thinner everywhere even now (good news for the legs and pits, not so good for the head). My eyelashes are the closest to being the same as before, yay!! Also don't need to tweeze my eyebrows anymore. Unfortunately, I have a little more of a mustache, but that could be related to age and chemo-induced menopause. Fortunatly, the hair on my face is mostly blonde, LOL....
Pegzilla#2 (an old-timer from WAY BACK - originally from the iVillage board)
Posts.Title: Today marks 1 year...

Posts.Content:
OMG, I haven't seen Peg Gray (she's Pegzilla #1, you know) in a LONG time. Do you suppose we could convince her to come visit us if we can get a gathering put together???? I am totally clueless about
 what happened previously, and frankly, don't give a flying *****. I'd love to see her again.
If anybody talks to her, tell her "hi" from Pegzilla#2...and Pegzilla #3 is undoubtedly smiling down on us and flapping her (pink) wings. That's where the feathers come from, right???
Hope to see you all soon, Peg V. aka Pegzilla #2.
Posts.Title: For our oldtimers......

Posts.Content:

Congrats, Lauri, and have a wonderful grammy time!
Love, Peg
Posts.Title: Grandson's name is Luke Michael

Posts.Content:
Hello everyone!
I'm FINISHED with class work. Just waiting to get my grades (assuming that I did okay on my final paper, LOL), and then graduation is May 21. Yep, on Mothers Day.
I'd LOVE it if we could get a gathering together, and I'd be happy to help plan one, even if it's not close to me. I am actually having trouble figuring out what to do with myself sometimes! After two years of class work on the weekends, it's kind of weird not having research or reading or a paper to write.
So, should we start thinking about
 a time and place? We had discussed Cleveland at one time (and I still have not been to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame !)....
What do you all think?
Love to all, Peg V

If Marshall's Thundering Herd (yeah, I know, great name, LOL) Band is ever on TV, and they might be since they'll be playing at a Bengals game (at least, I think they are), watch for a short saxophone player!!!!
(My DS is still home, and won't head off to college for his sophomore year until mid-September....then we'll truly be EMPTY NESTERS. Don't know yet how I feel about
 that.)

We love you !! ((((((((((((((((((CATHI))))))))))))))))))))

Posts.Title: Cleveland Dates to choose from

Posts.Content:
Oh, CR@P, SH#T, and all of the other words I can't type for fear of getting banned from the Internet. This s*cks big time. Cathi is the LAST person who should be going through this. She has helped so many people on this board and previous boards.
Luci, please tell Cathi we all love her, but don't want to flood her with phone calls. I think she knows anyway. Strong but gentle pink hugs for you, for Cathi, and for all of us.
How about a card shower, everybody????? Maybe we can all send the FUNNIEST cards we can find, for any occasion, just as long as they are funny....what do you think? Cathi would probably appreciate the weird humor in getting a Halloween card right now!

Posts.Title: Cathi is in the hospital....

Posts.Content:
Gail, I went through some of that myself. After three years of taking my temperature, charting my cycles, and being disappointed monthly, I had a laparoscopy. They found the problem (in my case, endometriosis), and put me on hormones to shut my system down for 9 months. It worked, and I have two wonderful, healthy kids.
My uterus is also tipped, but not at the angle that they usually find. I don't think that's a fertility issue, but it may interfere with diagnosis, as Michelle said.
Stay hopeful, lots can be done!
From snowy (!!!!) Ohio, 
Peg
Posts.Title: Prayers please...

Posts.Content:
Well said!!!

I'm working on my masters degree, and it's hard to be student when I'm old enough to be the mother of most of my fellow students! I also started a new job in January, and it's keeping me hopping....my daughter is in track, which means we're going to track meets once or twice a week, and she'll be graduating from high school in June, heading to Marshall University in West Virginia in the fall. Time is just FLYING BY.
Hope to see you soon. Are you planning to come to Cleveland?
Love, Peg

Posts.Title: Chemo protocol...Xeloda questions....

Posts.Content:
Sorry to be AWOL so long. Yes, I'm going to school (getting masters in Marketing and Communication), working full time, trying to get my DD into college.....very busy. 
Candy, I tried to return your call, but got your answering machine.
Anyway, I'm fine, other than a sprained ankle (I fell at the high school...janitor mopping the floor didn't have one of those yellow "caution" signs, and I was, as usual, in a hurry). Coming up on my 6-year anniversary (discovered my lump in the shower on Good Friday 6 yrs ago).
I miss you all, but I can't seem to find the time to get on the board. It asked me for my logon and password, and I was terrified that I wouldn't be able to remember it, but I did!!!
Anyway, I think of you all often, but I will be swamped until about this time next year. You all can load up the PCE and COME TO MY GRADUATION!!!!!
Love to you all, Peg
Posts.Title: Where's Peg V?

Posts.Content:
My onc prescribed something she called "swish and swallow." The pharmacist mixed it up from several OTC ingredients. It didn't taste too bad, and worked for a while...it made everything numb! I think one of the ingredients was lydocaine (sp?).
Hope you get past the third-day yuckies quickly!!!
Love you lots, Peg

Posts.Title: I need help, my friends...

Posts.Content:
Ohio has been slammed. First there was snow (we got about 8", but parts of northern Ohio got as much as 36", just ask Cathi!!!)...then we had ice, which froze the surface of the snow hard enough to support the weight of our dog, 80 or so pounds. Parts of central Ohio had power outages as long as 6 days. Then rain, and the snow disappeared in about a day and a half. And then more rain. Then north of us more ice, and more rain.....and more to come, if the weather guys are right. I was very grateful that I had decided to hoard my vacation and take the whole last two weeks of 2004 off!
Personally, we're okay (no flooding, no power outages), but 59 (I think) out of 88 counties in Ohio are applying for federal disaster relief.
Yep, Ma Nature definitely hasn't been kind.
Anybody in real trouble? 
Love, Peg

Posts.Title: Happy Birthday to our sweet Luci......!!!!

Posts.Content:
Peg, 52 (sigh), from Westerville, Ohio (born and raised in Fairborn, OH)
Diagnosed stage II invasive lobular June 1999, lumpectomy with axillary dissection (one positive node), AC/Taxol and radiation. NED since then. Mother had modified radical mast 20+ years ago, and she's still kickin', one sister had lumpectomy about 10 years ago, and then recurrence requiring mast (with tram flap reconstruction) while I was doing radiation...ON MY BIRTHDAY, how rude. Other sister thankfully still healthy. Three women, four cancers, THREE SURVIVORS.
Married 30 years this September (to same man, LOL!). 2 kids, son graduating from high school this year, and daughter graduating next year. We'll be poor for a while, thanks to college expenses.
